monogr.title: A verry merry vvherry-ferry-voyage: or Yorke for my money : sometimes perilous, sometimes quarrellous, performed with a paire of oares, by sea from London, by Iohn Taylor, and Iob Pennell. And written by I.T
monogr.author: Taylor, John

keywords.term: Travel, topography, maps and navigational manuals

div.head: As much Happinesse as may bee wished, attend the Two hopefull, Impes of Gentility and Learning, Mr. RICHARD and GEORGE HATTON.
div.l: YOu forward Payre, in Towardly Designes,
To you I send these sowsde Salt-water Lines:
Accept, Reade, Laugh, and breath, and to't againe,
And still my Muse, and I, shall yours Remaine.
